detect_all([N], [N2]) :- 
 detect_number(N, N2).
detect_all([N,O|T], [N2,O2|T2]) :- 
 detect_number(N, N2), 
 detect_operator(O, O2), 
 detect_all(T, T2).
almost_equal(X, Y) :- 
 ground(Y), 
 abs(X - Y) < 0.0001.
almost_equal(X, Y) :- 
 var(Y), 
 Y is float(X).
expression(Images, Result) :- 
 detect_all(Images, Symbols), 
 parse(Symbols, Result).
parse([N], R) :- 
 almost_equal(N, R).
parse([N1, +, N2], R) :- almost_equal(R, N1 + N2).
parse([N1, -, N2], R) :- almost_equal(R, N1 - N2).
parse([N1, *, N2], R) :- almost_equal(R, N1 * N2).
parse([N1, /, N2], R) :- almost_equal(R, N1 / N2).
parse([N1, Op, N2|Rest], R) :- parse([N1, Op, N2], Temp), parse([Temp|Rest], R).
query(expression([image_2, image_divide, image_3, image_plus, image_3, image_minus, image_2, image_multiply, image_7], X)).
final_report: The generated code is not correct and does not meet the requirements. It fails to handle the parsing of complex expressions in the same way as the original code. The original code uses recursive parsing to handle expressions of arbitrary length, while the generated code only handles simple binary operations and attempts to chain them, which leads to an error during execution. The error occurs because the 'almost_equal' predicate is called with non-ground arguments, which violates its expected usage.
